title: Machine Learning for Public Administration Research, With Application to Organizational Reputation
research_description: This article explores the application of machine learning (ML) techniques to public administration research, particularly in understanding organizational reputation. Through a case study of federal agencies' tweets, the authors demonstrate how ML methods can provide insights into the reputation management strategies of public organizations.
research_results: The study found that ML methods, such as text mining, can help public organizations monitor and manage their reputation by analyzing large datasets of social media content. The analysis revealed key factors in how federal agencies build and maintain organizational reputation through communication on platforms like Twitter.
future_research: Future research should focus on expanding the application of ML to other areas of public administration and governance, including predictive modeling of public policies and decision-making processes.
